required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Thioldisulfide Balance in Cervical Preinvasive Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Thiol-disulfide Balance in Cervical Preinvasive Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate Thiol-disulfide balance in patients with cervical preinvasive lesions

detailed_description.textblock:
To date various oxidative stress paramaters were studied in patients with cervical preinvasive lesions, however dynamic thiol disulfide hemostasis has not been previously investigated. The thiol-disulfide balance in the circulation will be measured by the automated system created by Erel & Neselioglu(1).
References 1- Erel O, Neselioglu S. A novel and automated assay for thiol/ disulphide homeostasis. Clin Biochem 2014;47:326-32. doi:10.1016/ j.clinbiochem.2014.09.026.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (preoperative in the morning or preprandial for healthy volunteers)
primary_outcome.description: serum native thiol level in μmol/L

baseline (preoperative in the morning or preprandial for healthy volunteers)
primary_outcome.description: serum total thiol level in μmol/L

arm_group.description: low grade squamous intraepithelial lesion(LGSIL) n=100
high grade squamous intraepithelial lesion(HGSIL) n=100

intervention.description: Aforementioned oxidative stress markers will be measured via Cobas c501(Roche Diagnostics, Indianapolis, IN, USA) used with sphectrophotometry
Aforementioned oxidative stress markers will be measured via Cobas c501(Roche Diagnostics, Indianapolis, IN, USA) used with sphectrophotometry

study_pop.textblock: The diagnosis of preinvasive cervical lesions was made histopathologically by cervical biopsy. An experienced pathologist performed histopathologic examinations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Histopathologically confirmed diagnosis of LGSIL or HGSIL
Exclusion Criteria:
- pulmonary disease
- pulmonary hypertension
- cardiac dysfunction
- renal dysfunction
- liver disease
- chronic ishemia
- systemic inflammation
- other cervical biopy results than LGSIL or HGSIL
- concomitant malignancy
- patients who use vitamin A,C or E (antioxidant vitamins)
- patients who use smoke • patients who use drink alcohol
- patients who use addictive for any drug

facility.name: Mugla Sıtkı Kocman University Faculty of Medicine

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Intraepithelial Lesions of the Cervix
